alert.note: Alert for Hampden (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 12:00AM EST until December 20 at 12:09PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Connecticut River Below Holyoke affecting Hampden County. For the Connecticut River...including Holyoke...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River below Holyoke. * WHEN...From this morning to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 26.5 feet, Lowland flooding is expected along the Connecticut River below the Holyoke Dam south to Agawam and Longmeadow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 21.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 26.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 27.1 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 26.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 27.7 feet on 08/30/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at noon EST.
